reviewText: The movie covered the obvious racial issues living in the 50s butit explored beautiful music and the common love for it betweena black kid and a white kid, which brought them together in peace.I enjoyed watching this over and over and over again as a kid andso when i thoght to buy the DVD and found it on amazon, i can't tellyou how excited i was to own it! Audiences will love this film and thegreat ending!!! :)
Title: N/A

reviewText: Thank God I saw this on Netflix and didn't buy it...~Lord, is this movie the height of miscasting or what?Every one of the boy male leads is no less than 16,(most 17 at the time of the filming) and had alreadyreached puberty, ergo no soprano voices.Watching a 17 year old Justin Whalin lip syncing to a truesolo soprano as the wanna be 'lead boy' is a total joke andeven worse is that they'd have us believe that all his'adolescent'  roommates were also capable of suchhigh registers.  Maybe one 16 year old  out of athousand could possibly hold those notes but onlyfor so long.The only slightly believable one is actually the African American boyand only because of his stature even though at the time of the filming he was also 16.At least Disney's  "Almost Angels" was  properly castwith actual choir boys, (The Vienna Choir Boys) and theportrayed boy who joined the choir was of proper age.Even the plot made a point of showing a boy going throughthe change desperately trying to hide what was occurringand heartbroken over the loss of his beautiful sopranovoice.That was a much more believable scenario in allregards than this load of claptrap.Insofar as the racial aspects of this film theywere as believable as any other p/c film thatattempts to pander to the typical white breadDisney viewer but even for the 90's this was pushingthe boundaries of hokiness especially the portrayedfriendship between the lead white boy and the black.Think it would have been more believable hadJustin actually been about 14;  he had the empathydown pat but he just played too old for the part.The worst tragedy of this farce is that Disneynever gave credit to the real choir that performedall the vocals and worst, the true 'soloist' that actuallysang Whalen's lip synced parodies of a solo sopranowas not mentioned either!I've run the net back and forth trying to find out whichchoir performed all the choral pieces but can't find a thing.I suspect Disney's thumb is all over that and I'm surprisedthat after all this time no one has let the cat out of the bag.Anyone that truly enjoys the sound of boy choirs andthe remarkable skill that goes into their performancesshould be aghast at this travesty of this  film and thebounds of credibility it stretches past the pointof breaking.The  fact that they put out this garbage in1991 is even sadder, maybe I would have made allowancesfor a touch more had it been made in the 60's  but I thinkeven then tripe was still tripe and this be TRIPE!!

reviewText: Beautiful singing and good story. Well done family drama.  These boys and their teacher's love of vocal music can cross racial barriers.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love Disney movies and I had high expectations for this movie.  Maybe this movie had good intentions, but I had a hard time watching and enjoying this movie.  I liked the boy's singing, but I couldn't tolerate the racism and hatred.  The movie made me feel very uneasy.  I am very sensitive, maybe that's why.  I threw it away because it had the N word in it.  I know it's based on real life and that time period, but I don't understand it.  My husband didn't enjoy it either.  He didn't even want to finish it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I taped this movie from the Disney Channel many years ago when my daughter was in kindergarten.  One of her teachers borrowed it and ruined it.  I am so excited to have it once again.  I love the music and especially how they have incorporated spiritual music into the mix.  My daughter sang with her award winning, number one in the state school choral group and they sang some of these very songs.  They are allowed to do Christian music because it is part of the arts.  Sad, isn't it?This movie exemplified how easy it is to get along with others who are different if we will just make the effort.  Music draws people together.I am not going to let anyone borrow this one!

reviewText: Great movie.  I owned it on VHS and recently wanted the DVD version to share be able to share with more people.
